Key.Original:
%3Hunger%4 increases linearly with soldier's movement speed. Restore by eating a food item.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a food item.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Survival%4
%2Choose a food item to consume.
Key.English:
%3Hunger%4 increases linearly with soldier's movement speed. Restore by eating a food item.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a food item.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Survival%4
%2Choose a food item to consume.

Key.Original:
%3Thirst%4 increases linearly with soldier's movement speed. Restore by drinking a drink item.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a drink item.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Survival%4.
%2Choose a drink item to consume.
Key.English:
%3Thirst%4 increases linearly with soldier's movement speed. Restore by drinking a drink item.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a drink item.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Survival%4.
%2Choose a drink item to consume.

Key.Original:
The %3Fortify Tool%4 allows soldiers to build fortifications provided by their mission creator.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a %3FortifyTool%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Fortify%4.
%2Select an available fortification and follow the on screen prompts for placement.
Key.English:
The %3Fortify Tool%4 allows soldiers to build fortifications provided by their mission creator.

%3Usage:%4
%2Pick up a %3FortifyTool%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Fortify%4.
%2Select an available fortification and follow the on screen prompts for placement.

Key.Original:
%3Adenosine%4 is used to decrease heart rate.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Inject %3Adenosine%4.
Key.English:
%3Adenosine%4 is used to decrease heart rate.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Inject %3Adenosine%4.

Key.Original:
%3Bandages%4 stop bleeding and close wounds. Depending on your settings, bandages may reopen if surgery is not performed.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select a injured body part.
%2Bandage body part by selecting desired %3Bandage%4 type.
Key.English:
%3Bandages%4 stop bleeding and close wounds. Depending on your settings, bandages may reopen if surgery is not performed.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select a injured body part.
%2Bandage body part by selecting desired %3Bandage%4 type.

Key.Original:
%3IV fluids%4 restore lost blood volume. Blood, Plasma, and Saline are functionally the same.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Restore blood voluem by selecting desired %3IV Fluid%4 type.
Key.English:
%3IV fluids%4 restore lost blood volume. Blood, Plasma, and Saline are functionally the same.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Restore blood voluem by selecting desired %3IV Fluid%4 type.

Key.Original:
%3Epinephrine%4 increases Heartrate as well as decreases the time between conscious checks (effectively increasing conscious chance).

%3Usage%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Inject %3Epinephrine%4.
Key.English:
%3Epinephrine%4 increases Heartrate as well as decreases the time between conscious checks (effectively increasing conscious chance).

%3Usage%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an appendage.
%2Inject %3Epinephrine%4.

Key.Original:
A %3Splint%4 is used to fix fractures. The %3Splint%4 is consumed when used.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an affected appendage.
%2Select %3Apply Splint%4.
Key.English:
A %3Splint%4 is used to fix fractures. The %3Splint%4 is consumed when used.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an affected appendage.
%2Select %3Apply Splint%4.

Key.Original:
A %3Surgical Kit%4 is used to prevent wounds from reopening after being bandaged. Depending on settings, it can also clear trauma.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select %3Advanced Treatment%4.
%2Select %3Use Surgical Kit%4.
Key.English:
A %3Surgical Kit%4 is used to prevent wounds from reopening after being bandaged. Depending on settings, it can also clear trauma.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select %3Advanced Treatment%4.
%2Select %3Use Surgical Kit%4.

Key.Original:
A %3Tourniquet%4 stops bleeding temporarily so that a wound(s) can be bandaged. Can only be used on limbs.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an affected appendage.
%2Select %3Apply Tourniquet%4.
Key.English:
A %3Tourniquet%4 stops bleeding temporarily so that a wound(s) can be bandaged. Can only be used on limbs.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] or [%3%13%4] and select an affected appendage.
%2Select %3Apply Tourniquet%4.

Key.Original:
The %3Horus ATragMX%4 considers atmospheric conditions, gun data, ammunition, range, speed, and muzzle velocity to calculate precise aiming solutions with %3Come-Up%4 results - and even accounts for %3Coriolis%4 and %3Spin Drift%4 effects. %3ATragMX%4, loaded on a handheld computer made by %3TDS Recon%4, is easy to use and lightning fast. The %3Recon%4 meets the rigorous %3MIL-STD-810F%4 military standard for drops, vibration, humidity, altitude and extreme temperatures.

%3Usage:%4
Please visit the wiki page for more information
Key.English:
The %3Horus ATragMX%4 considers atmospheric conditions, gun data, ammunition, range, speed, and muzzle velocity to calculate precise aiming solutions with %3Come-Up%4 results - and even accounts for %3Coriolis%4 and %3Spin Drift%4 effects. %3ATragMX%4, loaded on a handheld computer made by %3TDS Recon%4, is easy to use and lightning fast. The %3Recon%4 meets the rigorous %3MIL-STD-810F%4 military standard for drops, vibration, humidity, altitude and extreme temperatures.

%3Usage:%4
Please visit the wiki page for more information

Key.Original:
%3Body Bags%4 are used to transport dead bodies. They can be dragged and loaded into vehicles.



%3Usage:%4
%2Approach a dead body.
%2Use [%3%12%4] or [%3%13%4] and select %3Place Body In Bodybag%4.
Key.English:
%3Body Bags%4 are used to transport dead bodies. They can be dragged and loaded into vehicles.



%3Usage:%4
%2Approach a dead body.
%2Use [%3%12%4] or [%3%13%4] and select %3Place Body In Bodybag%4.

Key.Original:
%3Cable Ties%4 enable a soldier to capture and detain another soldier. Once apprehended, the captor gains the ability to inspect the prisoner's belongings, set them free, or accompany them to an alternate area. Transporting escorted prisoners is also possible, including loading them into vehicles if needed.



%3Usage:%4
%2Approach the unit use [%3%12%4].
%2The interaction is located around the hands in the form of a handcuffs icon.
%2Repeat to release.
Key.English:
%3Cable Ties%4 enable a soldier to capture and detain another soldier. Once apprehended, the captor gains the ability to inspect the prisoner's belongings, set them free, or accompany them to an alternate area. Transporting escorted prisoners is also possible, including loading them into vehicles if needed.



%3Usage:%4
%2Approach the unit use [%3%12%4].
%2The interaction is located around the hands in the form of a handcuffs icon.
%2Repeat to release.

Key.Original:
The %3Cellphone%4 is functionally a %3Clacker%4. Use it to connect and detonate an explosive device. Multiple devices can be linked to the cellphone and called within the phonebook.

%3Usage:%4
%2Place an explosive.
%2Use [%3%12%4], select %3Explosives%4, and select %3Cellphone%4.
%2Open the cellphone interface with [%3%11%4].
%2Navigate the phone book with the arrows and select your calling number.
%2Call the number to detonate.
Key.English:
The %3Cellphone%4 is functionally a %3Clacker%4. Use it to connect and detonate an explosive device. Multiple devices can be linked to the cellphone and called within the phonebook.

%3Usage:%4
%2Place an explosive.
%2Use [%3%12%4], select %3Explosives%4, and select %3Cellphone%4.
%2Open the cellphone interface with [%3%11%4].
%2Navigate the phone book with the arrows and select your calling number.
%2Call the number to detonate.

Key.Original:
%3Chemlight Shields%4 give you the ability to read your map, even in the darkest environment. However, when using those %3Chemlight Shields%4, you will have a slight glow around you. Keep this in mind for PvP.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2elect %3Chemlights%4 and %3Prepare Chemlight Shield (Color)%4.
%2Open %3Map%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Flashlights%4 where you will find your chemlight shield.
Key.English:
%3Chemlight Shields%4 give you the ability to read your map, even in the darkest environment. However, when using those %3Chemlight Shields%4, you will have a slight glow around you. Keep this in mind for PvP.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2elect %3Chemlights%4 and %3Prepare Chemlight Shield (Color)%4.
%2Open %3Map%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Flashlights%4 where you will find your chemlight shield.

Key.Original:
Use %3Clackers%4 to connect and detonate an explosive device. Multiple devices can be linked to the clacker and detonated on different channels.

%3Usage:%4
%2Place an explosive.
%2Use [%3%12%4], select %3Explosives%4, and select %3Clacker%4.
%2Open the ACE interface with [%3%11%4].
%2Select %3Explosives%4 and select %3Clacker%4.
%2Select the %3Explosive%4 you wish to detonate.
Key.English:
Use %3Clackers%4 to connect and detonate an explosive device. Multiple devices can be linked to the clacker and detonated on different channels.

%3Usage:%4
%2Place an explosive.
%2Use [%3%12%4], select %3Explosives%4, and select %3Clacker%4.
%2Open the ACE interface with [%3%11%4].
%2Select %3Explosives%4 and select %3Clacker%4.
%2Select the %3Explosive%4 you wish to detonate.

Key.Original:
The %3Dead Man's Switch%4 is a device that allows a soldier to detonate an %3Explosive%4 when the soldier dies.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Explosives%4.
%2Select %3Dead Man's Switch%4 and connect the desired %3Explosive%4.
%2Repeat the process and disconnect to reverse.
Key.English:
The %3Dead Man's Switch%4 is a device that allows a soldier to detonate an %3Explosive%4 when the soldier dies.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Explosives%4.
%2Select %3Dead Man's Switch%4 and connect the desired %3Explosive%4.
%2Repeat the process and disconnect to reverse.

Key.Original:
%3Ear Plugs%4 help prevent hearing damage from repeat loud noises near a soldier. Insert %3Ear Plugs%4 to lower volume of a soldier's environment and prevent %3Combat Deafness%4.



%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Insert %3Ear Plugs%4.
Key.English:
%3Ear Plugs%4 help prevent hearing damage from repeat loud noises near a soldier. Insert %3Ear Plugs%4 to lower volume of a soldier's environment and prevent %3Combat Deafness%4.



%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Insert %3Ear Plugs%4.

Key.Original:
%3Flashlights%4 give you the ability to read your map, even in the darkest environment. However, when using those %3Flashlights%4, you will have a slight glow around you. Keep this in mind for PvP.

%3Usage:%4
%2On the map screen, use [%3%11%4] and select %3Flashlights%4.
%2Select the %3Flashlight%4 you want to use and select %3On%4.

%3Available Flashlight Items%4:
%2 Fulton MX-991
%2 KSF-1
%2 Maglite XL50

%3NOTE:%4
Flashlight states are persistent
Key.English:
%3Flashlights%4 give you the ability to read your map, even in the darkest environment. However, when using those %3Flashlights%4, you will have a slight glow around you. Keep this in mind for PvP.

%3Usage:%4
%2On the map screen, use [%3%11%4] and select %3Flashlights%4.
%2Select the %3Flashlight%4 you want to use and select %3On%4.

%3Available Flashlight Items%4:
%2 Fulton MX-991
%2 KSF-1
%2 Maglite XL50

%3NOTE:%4
Flashlight states are persistent

Key.Original:
The %3High-Altitude Unit Navigated Tactical Imaging Round (HuntIR)%4 is designed to be fired from a grenade launcher. After being fired in the air, the built-in parachute will be deployed and the IR CMOS camera will activate, providing a video stream until it touches the ground or is shot down.

%3Usage:%4
%2Equip a %3HuntIR Monitor%4 and compatible ammunition.
%2Fire the %3HuntIR Round%4 as high as possible over the area you want to observe.
%2Open the %3HuntIR Monitor%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4], select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Activate HuntIR Monitor%4.
Key.English:
The %3High-Altitude Unit Navigated Tactical Imaging Round (HuntIR)%4 is designed to be fired from a grenade launcher. After being fired in the air, the built-in parachute will be deployed and the IR CMOS camera will activate, providing a video stream until it touches the ground or is shot down.

%3Usage:%4
%2Equip a %3HuntIR Monitor%4 and compatible ammunition.
%2Fire the %3HuntIR Round%4 as high as possible over the area you want to observe.
%2Open the %3HuntIR Monitor%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4], select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Activate HuntIR Monitor%4.

Key.Original:
The %3IR Strobe%4 is a throwable that emits an IR light pulse intermittently. The %3IR Strobe%4 can also be attached to a soldier, making it useful for tracking teammates under night vision devices.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Attach%4 and select the %3IR Strobe%4.
Key.English:
The %3IR Strobe%4 is a throwable that emits an IR light pulse intermittently. The %3IR Strobe%4 can also be attached to a soldier, making it useful for tracking teammates under night vision devices.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Attach%4 and select the %3IR Strobe%4.

Key.Original:
The %3Map Tools%4 are a set of tools that allows a soldier to measure distances and angles. Useful for triangulating your position, and calculating firing solutions for artillery.

%3Usage:%4
%2Open %3Map%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Map Tools%4.
%2 Tool can be moved with [%3Left-Click%4] and [%3ALT%4].
Key.English:
The %3Map Tools%4 are a set of tools that allows a soldier to measure distances and angles. Useful for triangulating your position, and calculating firing solutions for artillery.

%3Usage:%4
%2Open %3Map%4.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Map Tools%4.
%2 Tool can be moved with [%3Left-Click%4] and [%3ALT%4].

Key.Original:
%3Range Tables%4 allow for a soldier to estimate accurate shot placement on direct or indirect targets (depending on asset). The %3Range Table%4 will automatically fill depending on the soldiers selected weapon/vehicle.



%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select the desired %3Range Table%4.
Key.English:
%3Range Tables%4 allow for a soldier to estimate accurate shot placement on direct or indirect targets (depending on asset). The %3Range Table%4 will automatically fill depending on the soldiers selected weapon/vehicle.



%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select the desired %3Range Table%4.

Key.Original:
%3Ropes%4 have multiple uses including %3Towing%4 vehicles and %3Fast Roping%4 from helicopters.

%3Towing:%4
%2Approach a vehicle.
%2Use [%3%12%4] and select %3Towing%4.
%2Select rope length.
%2Select attachment point on towing vehicle.
%2Select attachment on towed vehicle.

%3Available Rope Lengths:%4
%2 3.2 meters
%2 6.2 meters
%2 12.2 meters
%2 15.2 meters
%2 18.3 meters
%2 27.4 meters
%2 36.6 meters
Key.English:
%3Ropes%4 have multiple uses including %3Towing%4 vehicles and %3Fast Roping%4 from helicopters.

%3Towing:%4
%2Approach a vehicle.
%2Use [%3%12%4] and select %3Towing%4.
%2Select rope length.
%2Select attachment point on towing vehicle.
%2Select attachment on towed vehicle.

%3Available Rope Lengths:%4
%2 3.2 meters
%2 6.2 meters
%2 12.2 meters
%2 15.2 meters
%2 18.3 meters
%2 27.4 meters
%2 36.6 meters

Key.Original:
%3Spare Barrels%4 allow a soldier to reduce their weapon's heat significantly. After a short delay, the barrel will be swapped and heat reduced. A soldier may also check the temp of any barrels within their inventory.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Swap Barrel%4.
%2Resume operation after barrel swap is complete.
Key.English:
%3Spare Barrels%4 allow a soldier to reduce their weapon's heat significantly. After a short delay, the barrel will be swapped and heat reduced. A soldier may also check the temp of any barrels within their inventory.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3Swap Barrel%4.
%2Resume operation after barrel swap is complete.

Key.Original:
%3Spray Paint%4 is used to tag structures with various symbols.

%3Usage:%4
%2Move close to a wall.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Tag%4.
%2Choose a symbol.



%3Available Colors:%4
%2Black
%2Blue
%2Green
%2Red
Key.English:
%3Spray Paint%4 is used to tag structures with various symbols.

%3Usage:%4
%2Move close to a wall.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Tag%4.
%2Choose a symbol.



%3Available Colors:%4
%2Black
%2Blue
%2Green
%2Red

Key.Original:
The %3SSWT Kit%4 is a deployable tripod that allows a soldier to brace their aim when deployed. Use it when you need an elevated shooting position and there are no other objects around.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3SSWT Kit%4 and follow the on screen prompts to place.
Key.English:
The %3SSWT Kit%4 is a deployable tripod that allows a soldier to brace their aim when deployed. Use it when you need an elevated shooting position and there are no other objects around.

%3Usage:%4
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Equipment%4.
%2Select %3SSWT Kit%4 and follow the on screen prompts to place.

Key.Original:
%3Wirecutters%4 are a tool that allows a soldier to bipass wired fencing. Useful for creating backdoor entrances into secure areas.

%3Usage:%4
%2Move close to a fence.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Cut Fence%4.
Key.English:
%3Wirecutters%4 are a tool that allows a soldier to bipass wired fencing. Useful for creating backdoor entrances into secure areas.

%3Usage:%4
%2Move close to a fence.
%2Use [%3%11%4] and select %3Cut Fence%4.
